intro: Tithymalus oschtenicus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in gardens for its delicate appearance and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
